page.title: 10POPULATION OF TADLEY (SEX)
page.content: The statistics provided for the Tadley area show a variation from the norm in the proportions of men and women in the general population of the UK. Overall the percentages are 51.4% women and 48.6% men. In the Tadley area the figures are reversed with 48.8% women and 51.2% men. Only over the age of 70 do women outnumber men. Undoubtedly the main cause of this is the number of young, single men living in Boundary Hall, most of them working at the AWRE. Presumably many of them later marry and set up home outside our survey area. There are also many more men in the 45-60 age group than might be expected, some of them living in Boundary Hall. (Boundary Hall is a hostel, like a University Hall of Residence, mainly intended for single staff of the AWRE.)
